page.title: 03FARMING IN MARSHFIELD CONTD.
page.content: None of the farms in this area milk dairy cows. Some small-holdings - from two to ten acres - exist with goats, hens and geese. A portion is used by two horticulturalists for root crops. The winter of 1984/5 was very severe at times, temperatures being well below freezing on many occasions. This affected winter sown crops. Spring and early summer were wet and very little hay was made in good condition. The big bale silage was more popular and enabled winter feed to be harvested. The grain harvest was late but a fine spell in Septemer allowed the combines to get most of the crops in. The bushel weight is light this season due to the extreme wet.
